page.title: 04ROAD SYSTEMS
page.content: Easterley Rd (A58) is part of the main road from Leeds to Wetherby and the Great North Road(A1). It is very busy with local and long distance traffic. Until a few years ago it was used by many very big lorries, some of which carried loads which would be dangerous in an accident. People living along the A58 (including Easterley Rd) pursuaded the government to ban such vehicles, which now bring danger to the A64 Leeds to York Rd instead. Easterley Rd is lined on both sides by houses of a good standard and separated by their gardens from the road. It is a dual carriageway road with a grassy strip dividing traffic travelling in opposite directions. This helps to make it safer for traffic, but does encourags drivers to travel too fast for pedestrian safety.
